label: 検非違使
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Officials in charge of keeping law and order. Their main office in Kyōto was known as the Office of the Imperial Police (Kebiishichō ). The head official or Chief was known as the Bettō. [検非違使庁、別当]
